question: Hi there, just putting this out there for advice/information.I am one of seven children.   My father had lymphoma back in the 50s and was treated with Cobalt radiation therapy and survived until 1972 when he passed with a stroke.    My mother died at 86 with probable lymphoma.   My oldest sister has  Waldenstroms Macroglobulinemia (type of lymphoma).  My next sister has multiple myeloma.  My third sister died last year of pancreatic cancer.   My next sibling, a brother died of complications of diabetes.  The next one is extremely healthy.   Then there is me...... I have IgM MGUS which is a precursor state of both WM as above and multiple myeloma.   My youngest sibling, male, I am not aware of his health.Incidentally,  my children have autoimmune disorders as follows.  Eldest male has ulcerative colitis, daughter has some sort of neuropathy and my youngest son has ankylosing spondylitis.What do you think of the chances of one family having so many blood disorders and autoimmune problems.  Would any of you think this is worth seeing a genetic service about this.   Regards.    Patricia.I
title: Familial cancer
